Row.Text: Heat wave!
Every summer seems hotter than the last, and our lakes and rivers are drying up. Soon a drought may be upon us. What should we do?[NEWLINE]
We cannot allow this to happen! Subsidize the farms.
[NEWLINE]Use {1_YieldCost} to provide additional water resources to farmers across the empire. You are confident that you can avoid a drought.
Just in case there is something to this, let's set aside some national emergency funds.
[NEWLINE]You allocate {1_YieldCost} from the national treasury to offset any potential damages. You are hopeful that you can avoid a drought.
We have to look like we are taking this seriously. Send some money to local officials.
[NEWLINE]You send {1_YieldCost} to the local governors. At least it will look like you did something if people start asking questions.
Grin and bear it. There's nothing we can do.
[NEWLINE]Unfortunately, we don't have the funds to do anything. Let's hope for cooler, wetter weather soon.
Ice age!

It seems like every year is a little bit colder, and the sun doesn't seem to shine as brightly as it used to. Our Science Advisor is telling us that average temperatures seem to be dropping across the known world. How should we prepare?[NEWLINE]
People should stay indoors, even if that means less commerce.
[NEWLINE]Expect overall tax collections in each City to lose {3_CityYieldGlobal} for {4_Turns}.
Take fuel from our industries and distribute it to the poor and needy.
[NEWLINE] This fuel diversion results in a loss of {3_CityYieldGlobal} in each City for {4_Turns}.
Let's deal with problems as they arise.
We should probably expect the cold to cause problems in our Cities.
la Grande DÃ©luge

Weather patterns seem to be getting wetter and wetter. Our rivers and streams are running full, and water abounds. It seems like we are only one big storm away from disaster. What would you like to do?[NEWLINE]
We can not prevent the rain from falling, but hopefully, we can prevent major damage from occuring. How is our Treasury looking?
[NEWLINE]Allocate {1_YieldCost} to build flood control infrastructure in all our cities.
We can not prevent the rain from falling, but hopefully, we can prevent major damage from occuring. Mobilize our militia to help.
[NEWLINE]Allocate {1_YieldCost} to build flood control infrastructure in all our cities.
It's only a little rain. I have more important things to focus on.
[NEWLINE]As long as it doesn't keep raining too much, we should be okay.
Belching Smokestacks and Dirty Water

With the shift in our economy towards larger scale manufacturing, energy-intenstive industries are springing up everywhere. With little regulation and unrestrained growth, the very air we breathe and water we drink is becoming unfit for use. Our waterways are toxic channels, full of slime and dead fish. The smell of smoke is constantly in the air, and the stain of soot is all over our buildings and clothes. We must rein in these industrialists, or the consequences could be dire.[NEWLINE]

Dead fish and unbreathable air? I even hear that one of our rivers even caught on fire and burned for days! Have our Science Advisor and Economic Advisor work together to come up with some kind of rules to govern these industries.
[NEWLINE]As a result of these regulations, [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production in all of our Cities is reduced by 5%. But look at the clear air and taste the clean water!
We are building the greatest civilization in the world! We cannot be slowed down for bugs and bunnies.
[NEWLINE]Machines are our future. The future is now!
Clean Air, Part Une
Finally! The political winds have shifted, and we have another chance to slow down our industries.[NEWLINE]
Our farmers have suffered enough. Get me some kind of framework for new laws so we can and do something about the environment.

[NEWLINE]As a result of these regulations, [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production in all of our Cities is reduced by 5%. But, if you look out the window, you can see the air is just a little bit clearer...and the water doesn't taste quite so bad.
Industry is the mark of modern mankind. We will not be slowed down.
[NEWLINE]Machines are our future. The future is now!
Clean Air, Part Une
This may be the last chance, but we have another opportunity to do something to heal the damage that our industry has done to the land. A little pain now might just save a lot of pain later.[NEWLINE]
It seems like we don't have much of a choice. Let's pass some kind of legislation to protect our future.

[NEWLINE]As a result of this new legislation, [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production in all of our Cities is reduced by 5%. Hopefully, if given enough time, our citizens will be able to step outside without their lungs burning and eyes watering.
Enough with these infernal requests! Needless regulation will only slow down our economy.
[NEWLINE]Machines are our future. The future is now!
Clean Air and Water Environmental Regulations
Clean Air and Water Environmental Regulations help control industry to prevent pollution. By slightly reducing a City's productivity, local farms are able to thrive.
Plague Looming

Your advsiors tell you of a distant, virulent disease that is crippling other empires. Hopefully, the disease stays far away from our land. Our Science Advisor is advising that we quarantine our cities.[NEWLINE]
Let's follow his advice. That's why we have advisors in the first place.
[NEWLINE]Our Economic Advisor has looked over the numbers and figures the reduction in taxes from this is going to cost the Treasury {3_CityYieldGlobal} from each City for {4_Turns}.
We are not stifling commerce for a mere rumor.
[NEWLINE]Do nothing.
